activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-1016)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zamontae Burch

defendant.name: Burch, Zamontae

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:37 AM Defendant Zamontae Burch in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Zamontae Burch.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed. 
THE DEFENDANT REQUESTS TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM PRAIRIE DU CHIEN CORRECTIONAL FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE, BUT WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.
Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 17th, 2022.
AMENDED Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
Detainer placed at: Prairie du Chien Correctional

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:00 PM Defendant Zamontae Burch appeared by zoom video, in custody at Prairie du Chien Correctional.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Zamontae Burch. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marufo.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Prairie du Chien Correctional.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
